name: Windy Hill Resort

reviews.text: The hillside is full of little cottages which we found clean and comfortable. The pool area was quiet and breezy. Tony the bartender was great with the kids before dinner, playing a few rounds of pool and ping pong. We ate breakfast and dinner in their restaurant were pleased the food selection. This is not an "all inclusive, five star", but I found this to be a terrific little spot and a good value! I would go back again.
reviews.title: Terrificly tropical

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just came back from another trip to Belize and after staying on the Southern part of the country for the most part of my trip. I decided to stay an overnight at Windy Hills Resort since I was attending a wedding in the area on that weekend. Let me first start by saying the pictures online for the cabin w/AC looked nice; however, the cabin w/AC was very basic for the price. After looking at the room and property for Cahal Pech Resort we wanted to swich properties,but it was too late for us to change. The amenties and pool at Cahal Pech was inviting and up to standard. The pool area at Windy Hills was less to be desired. We decided to make the best out of our stay.
reviews.title: Not Impressed, short on staff, and very basic for price

reviews.text: One positive thing is the resort grounds was well kept. On the other hand the staff was slow and I believe we were told they were low on staff. We went to the bar and tried to order a couple of beers. They didn't have heineken which is a pretty standard beer throughout the world. We ask for top shelf liquor and they didnt' have any top shelf tequila either. We then settled for a lime margarita and ordered some food and request they take to pool-side while we swam. Long story short it took them over 1 hour to bring our drinks and food. We met other vacationers that wanted to order food as well poolside and the bartender staff never came back to take their order the whole 2 plus hours we were in and near the pool. We asked about their onsite spa they advertised on the property and they actually don't have an onsite spa, they call someone off the property for double the price. You would be better off going in town and getting an massage directly with the third party for a reasonable price. I would not stay at this property again or recommend them to my friends.
reviews.title: Most attentive service and a beautiful resort

reviews.text: I would rather stay at Cahal Pech which is 15 dollars cheaper their room/pool/ and bar looked very nice and like a better value. We visited both properies to compare; but had already checked into Wendy Hills and they would not let us change after the fact.
reviews.title: A staff that makes you feel like family

reviews.text: The staff at the Windy Hill resorts made my stay most memorable. The were not only curtious but prompt to respond to our needs and inquiries. The bungalows were quite nice and very clean and the infinity pool most appealing. The grounds are simply decorate and quite beautiful with various flowers and trees. All in all a very nice resort with a great staff.
reviews.title: Very friendly & helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After spending time diving on Turneffe Atoll and vegging on Caye Caulker, my g/f and I spent 2 nights at Windy Hill. We purchased the package containing all transport, food, and tours of Xunantunich and Tikal. From the moment we were picked up, we were impressed.
reviews.title: A perfect inland retreat

reviews.text: The wonderful experience all started when Windy Hill picked us up from the Caye Caulker Water Taxi terminal, and the 2 hour drive from there to the resort turned out to be a historical tour of Belize. Edgar, who picked us up and was also our guide for Xunantunich, pointed out everything along the way that related to Mayan and Belizian culture, including the "Sleeping Giant" mountain formation that looks like a giant Mayan sleeping facing East and West. We felt like the car ride was actually a bonus tour.
reviews.title: Delightful Staff, Delightful Place!

reviews.text: That afternoon the Xunantunich tour was spectacular with the help of Edgar, who was one of the best guides I've ever met. He was passionate not only about the culture, site, and history, but he was adamant that we understood it and really got our minds thinking. Even better, it was only us 2 on the tour, so it was literally our own private tour. Be sure to ask for him if you take this tour, you won't regret it.
reviews.title: Windy hill took care of us!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 2nd day was a day trip to Tikal, and it couldn't have been more smooth. We were transported across the border with ease, picked up our tour guide, and spent the entire mid morning to early afternoon immersed in Tikal. Even better once again, since February is the slower season, it turned out that the tour was only us 2 again, so we spent the entire day in Tikal on, once again, a private tour. This time with Joshua, a Guatemalan guide who had been doing this for 10 years, who also was passionate that we actually absorb the history and open our minds. We felt like we had traveled back in time. While there, we also saw howler and spider monkeys, coati, and wild turkeys.
reviews.title: Great Place with Amazing Staff

reviews.text: While at the resort, all of the staff pampered us, especially Amin and Tony. Everyone was friendly, the food was really good, the bar was fun, and the bed was actually the most comfortable of the trip.
reviews.title: Excellent Lodge for Adventure Seekers and Families!

reviews.text: The accommodations were pretty good for San Ignacio, though I must admit that the standards there are pretty low. The grounds of the hotel were gorgeous, huge with beautiful fauna and wildlife. The rooms were in decent condition, spacious with air conditioning. The shower was awful though. The only way to make it even a little warm was to put it on a very low pressure, Barely enough to shower properly. You pretty much have to rent a car If you want to go anywhere, but that is standard for the area. The hotel is very close to the town by car and the town has a bunch of restaurants, though not much else. All in all I would recommend this hotel but it's certainly far from perfect.
reviews.title: Good accommodations

reviews.text: Stayed there for an overnight, Oct 6 2012, room was very clean and comfortable, quiet and relaxing stay, great place to unwind, the gardens and lawn was amazing. I stayed with my wife and 2 kids, 9 and 1 1/2 year old, they both enjoyed it very much. The pool was great, birds everywhere around. The Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was well prepared and served by a very helpful waiter. I will surely book here again when in San Ignacio.
reviews.title: Tranquil, comfortable frinedly stay.

reviews.text: And I must mention my stay here was all free, the management do a great part in partnering with local sporting organizations to promote a healthy lifestyle and encourage the youths into more positive activities. The package was a prize to a wining participant in the 12th Annual Lion Man Triathlon held here in Belize.
reviews.title: Had a nice relaxing time

reviews.text: I stayed there over the Carnival weekend with my daughter and I will go back. I had a nice relaxing time. They need to get wifi in the rooms and a little fridge. The beds were a bit hard too.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds / great service

reviews.text: I found the food a bit expensive but had a great horse back ride with Hana Stables and they got a reasonable cab for me to visit the Maya ruins......
reviews.title: Great cabin and infinity pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Accommodations are more than adequate but not luxurious. Pleased to see the bedding had been updated since our last stay here two years ago. I always travel with my sleep sack to keep away "bed cooties" but felt no need to use it here. The staff always went above and beyond to meet our every need. We prebooked our excursions prior to leaving the US. Our one stipulation was to not do the Jaguar Cave Tubing on the same day as a cruise ship was in port. Windy Hill arranged all our excursions around this request. Don't miss the the ATM cave - truly amazing. Do miss the Mountain Pine Ridge Reserve unless you want to ride on a bumpy dusty road for more than an hour one way just to glimpse the 1000' waterfall from a great distance. The Rio Frio pools and Big Rock were a lot of fun. There aren't really any pines in the reserve of any size. Having visited many Mayan ruins previously we did not include them this trip but they are well worth seeing. The bag lunches leave a lot to be desired so pack some nabs or protein bars. The resort food was fantastic. You must try the chicken soup! The staff was happy to bring me anything off the menu at any time. My favorite was a plate of fruit - had one at every meal! The grounds are lovely. I would love to go back.
reviews.title: Great Staff Eager to Please

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We blew out of Belize City as fast as we could and extended our stat at Windy Hill. The staff is the best in town. Always smiling mostly Mayas with great pride in the best service possible for their guests. A bit of a hike to our cabin which you will not want to leave! (Windy HILL) but it was good because of all of the walking we did at nearby locations. Make you guide reservations with Hector. He is absolutely fantastic. Very knowledgable and kind. We also went to Tecal from this location very easily. They have a gym but you will not use it if you walk to your cabin a couple of times a day. The restaurant is good and the staff is superior. So is the bartender and bar. Don't forget the front desk staff very helpful. You'll love it and the price was within our budget.
reviews.title: What a nice find.

reviews.text: We were at this resort from Jan. 25 - 30th, 2013 and the staff and accommodations were superb. The staff will do everything in their power to help make your stay as relaxing or exciting as you want it. When we arrived we had plans for a day trip to the Caracol Ruins but our desk clerk suggested we postpone the trip one day because of the weather. Not that the weather was going to be extremely bad just that there was a chance of rain for the day. We took him up on the suggestion and we were very happy with the outcome. We got to spend an unexpected day touring San Ignacio and Santa Elena and the next day completed out trip to the Ruins. Awe inspiring!!!! The pictures cannot do the resort or the ruins justice. Even with a little rain and cloud we still came away with wonderful tans. Thank you Windy Hills you helped to make the start of our Belizian adventure absolutely smooth and a wonderful experience.
reviews.title: Super friendly staff and great accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a recent trip to Belize we spent 3 days/nights at Windy Hill Resort. I was under the impression we'd be walking distance from the "downtown" area, but with the heat and humidity, we weren't keen on the walking idea. Instead, we opted for cab rides back and forth, which were about $5 USD each.
reviews.title: Pleasant Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the actual grounds of Windy Hill, there is a front office, which also houses a small gift shop. This front area is where you'll be able to access wi-fi. Across a small road from the front office, you'll find a walkway that leads to the restaurant, the bar, the gym, the pool and the cabins.
reviews.title: Adventure in the Mayan Ruins

description: Jungle Rivers, Maya Temples, Gentle Mountain Breezes...Service Extraordinaire! Located in the foothills of the Maya Mountains, the most diverse and beautiful area of Belize, Windy Hill Resort & Tour Company provides all the modern conveniences in a lush tropical setting and just minutes away from the archaeological sites and other popular attractions in Belize.
